Token.Abstract: An RMShapeAnnotation is an abstract subclass of RMAnnotation that is used to represent a shape consisting of one or more points. You should not create instances of this class directly. Instead, you should create instances of the RMPolylineAnnotation or RMPolygonAnnotation classes. However, you can use the properties of this class to access information about the specific points associated with the line or polygon.

Parameter.Name: aMapView
Parameter.Abstract: The map view on which to place the annotation.

Parameter.Name: points
Parameter.Abstract: An array of CLLocation points defining the shape. The data in this array is copied to the new object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An initialized shape annotation object, or nil if an annotation was unable to be initialized.

Token.Abstract: The array of points associated with the shape. (read-only)
The array of points associated with the shape. (read-only)
